intro: Cyclopogon inaequilaterus, commonly known as the irregular-armed cyclopogon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Arecaceae family, which includes palms, and is characterized by its unique leaf structure. The plant features a slender trunk and pinnate leaves with varying lengths of leaflets, giving it its common name. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to salt spray and sandy soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
